content: If I enter HTML tags in a node title, the tags are escaped and printed out whenever the node title is displayed. Is there any easy way to override this to avoid escaping HTML tags in titles?
Do you want to strip the tags instead, or do you want to allow them?
I want to allow them (to format parts of the title differently)
I've actually just worked out how to add <span> tags where I want them via Javascript, but if there's an eaier way with PHP, etc., then I might opt for that instead.
Ah, OK, no custom theme in that case... I'd only know a quick trick in theme_preprocess_layout(), but in that case you can't implement that.
Well I'll likely sub-theme Basis to make my own changes here and there. Would theme_preprocess_layout() work everywhere node titles are displayed (e.g. teasers, page titles, views, etc.)?
If you also need node teasers and stuff, you probably need additional preprocessors for node.tpl.php. Views... could be tricky.
Hmm ok, think I'll stick with JS then :-)
I guess, the minimum you need is template_preprocess_node and template_preprocess_layout - depends on what and where... js could be the easier thing.

(Curiosity is my cryptonite...)
in YOURTHEME_preprocess_layout()

  if ($node = menu_get_object()) {
    $variables['title'] = filter_xss($node->title, array('strong', 'span', 'em'));
  }

In YOURTHEME_preprocess_node:

  $node = $variables['node'];
  $variables['title'] = filter_xss($node->title, array('strong', 'span', 'em'));

That keeps strong/span/em and strips anything else.
